{{ddcl|header=chrono|since=c++20|
template&lt; class Duration, class TimeZonePtr, class CharT &gt;
struct formatter&lt;std::chrono::zoned_time&lt;Duration, TimeZonePtr&gt;, CharT&gt;
    : std::formatter&lt;/*local-time-format-t*/&lt;Duration&gt;, CharT&gt;
}}

Specialization of {{lc|std::formatter}} that defines formatting rules for a {{lc|std::chrono::zoned_time}}.

This formatter uses {{ltt|cpp/chrono/local_t/formatter|std::chrono::local_time_format}} for formatting.

The {{tt|parse}} member is inherited from the base class.

Let {{tt|tp}} be the formatting argument, {{tt|ctx}} be the [[cpp/utility/format/basic_format_context|formatting context]]. The behavior of the {{tt|format}} member is equivalent to
{{source|1=
auto info = tp.get_info();
return std::formatter&lt;/*local-time-format-t*/&gt;::format(
    std::local_time_format(tp.get_local_time(), &amp;info.abbrev, &amp;info.offset), ctx);
}}

The {{lc|std::formatter}} specialization is usually not directly accessed, but is used through [[cpp/utility/format|formatting functions]].
